@starkandlime @Ethan_Heilman @theinstagibbs the other big thing is that bitcoin transaction have total ordering, you can't arbitrarily swap the order of them within a block and have the block still be valid unlike in ETH how invalid transactions that pay gas can be mined

instead, they pre-compute look up tables that contain multiples of G (2G, 3G, 5G, etc): https://t.co/YDxh5GdarU

these tables are then used to reduce the amount of point additions it takes to do k*G: break up k into smaller chunks, look up those chunks in the table, sum chunks
